methods.name: __construct
methods.description: Constructor.

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.name
params.description: Output only. The resource name of this Instance. Resource names are schemeless URIs that follow the conventions in https://cloud.google.com/apis/design/resource_names. Format: projects/{project}/locations/{location}/instances/{instance}

params.name: data.id
params.description: An identifier for the Instance, generated by the backend.

params.name: data.create_time
params.description: Output only. Create a time stamp.

params.name: data.update_time
params.description: Output only. Update a time stamp.

params.name: data.machine_type
params.description: The server type. Available server types

params.name: data.state
params.description: The state of the server.

params.name: data.hyperthreading_enabled
params.description: True if you enable hyperthreading for the server, otherwise false. The default value is false.

params.name: data.labels
params.description: Labels as key value pairs.

params.name: data.luns
params.description: List of LUNs associated with this server.

params.name: data.networks
params.description: List of networks associated with this server.

params.name: data.interactive_serial_console_enabled
params.description: True if the interactive serial console feature is enabled for the instance, false otherwise. The default value is false.

params.name: data.os_image
params.description: The OS image currently installed on the server.

params.name: data.pod
params.description: Immutable. Pod name. Pod is an independent part of infrastructure. Instance can be connected to the assets (networks, volumes) allocated in the same pod only.

params.name: data.network_template
params.description: Instance network template name. For eg, bondaa-bondaa, bondab-nic, etc. Generally, the template name follows the syntax of "bond" or "nic".

params.name: data.logical_interfaces
params.description: List of logical interfaces for the instance. The number of logical interfaces will be the same as number of hardware bond/nic on the chosen network template. For the non-multivlan configurations (for eg, existing servers) that use existing default network template (bondaa-bondaa), both the Instance.networks field and the Instance.logical_interfaces fields will be filled to ensure backward compatibility. For the others, only Instance.logical_interfaces will be filled.

methods.name: getLogicalInterfaces
methods.description:
List of logical interfaces for the instance. The number of logical interfaces will be the same as number of hardware bond/nic on the chosen network template. For the non-multivlan configurations (for eg, existing servers) that use existing default network template (bondaa-bondaa), both the Instance.networks field and the Instance.logical_interfaces fields will be filled to ensure backward compatibility. For the others, only Instance.logical_interfaces will be filled.

Generated from protobuf field repeated .google.cloud.baremetalsolution.v2.LogicalInterface logical_interfaces = 15;
